subject: Re: Reporting more then 1 failed assertion per test
msgSnippet: Sorry if I m reading this wrong. ... That s not required (at least not enforced).  Test names can be whatever you like.  *If* you want to run with
messageBody:
Sorry if I'm reading this wrong.

--- In junit@y..., Mike Duffy <mduffy_lists@y...> wrote:
> I think the only requirement for JUnit is that test names begin with
> "test" so that they can be run through intropsection.
>

That's not required (at least not enforced). Test names can be
whatever you like. *If* you want to run with introspection, the test
names must start with "test". But there are other ways to run tests,
like overriding "runTest", for instance. Or providing a suite()
method. The JUnit Cookbook has this example:

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite= new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(new MoneyTest("testMoneyEquals"));
suite.addTest(new MoneyTest("testSimpleAdd"));
return suite;
}

but it would work the same (though maybe not be as readable) if
the "test" methods were renamed:

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite= new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(new MoneyTest("moneyEqualsCheck"));
suite.addTest(new MoneyTest("simpleAddCheck"));
return suite;
}


Someone else claimed the "test" prefix was a requirement recently
(message 2126). If I'm wrong and it is a req, please correct me.
